parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date that the microbiology specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microbiology findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the Microbiology Findings CRF using the date (MBDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation or specimen collection date can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not the planned measurement, series of measurements, tests, or observations was performed or specimen was collected. \n
fields.definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement or series of measurements, tests, or observations was performed, or specimen was collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. For the SDTM submission dataset, the SDTMIG variable MBSTAT is populated using the CDASH field MBPERF. The question text used might be reflected in the reason not done (MBREASND).
fields.label: Microbiology Sampling Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MBSTAT. If MBPERF = "N", the value of MBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MBPERF = "Y", MBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MBCAT and MBSCAT, MBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD would be populated as MBALL and an appropriate test name (MBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: MBPERF
fields.questionText: Was [specimen type] collected or [test topic] performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBREFID

fields.definition: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.
fields.implementationNotes: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).
fields.label: MB Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: MBREFID
fields.questionText: What was the (microbiology test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBGRPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions as to when it may be appropriate to group MB specimen records within a subject and how to indicate the specific MBGRPID.
fields.definition: A group identifier used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
fields.implementationNotes: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject. Should not be used to link detection records in MB to the associated susceptibility results in the MS domain. NHOID should be used to identify the non-host organism.
fields.label: MB Group ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MBGRPID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the (start) date when specimen collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG MBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: MBDAT
fields.questionText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: MBTIM
fields.questionText: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the microbiology finding category, if not pre-pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.
fields.label: MB Category for Microbiology Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MBCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the microbiology finding?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the microbiology finding subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the MBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. MBSCAT can only be used if there is an MBCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MBCAT.
fields.label: MB Subcategory for Microbiology Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MBSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the microbiology finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78734

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBSPEC

fields.definition: The type of sample material taken from a biological entity.
fields.implementationNotes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.
fields.label: MB Specimen Type
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MBSPEC
fields.questionText: What is the specimen material type?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78733

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBSPCCND

fields.definition: Description of the condition of the specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.
fields.label: MB Specimen Condition
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MBSPCCND
fields.questionText: What was the condition of the specimen?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MBLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MBLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Processing.MBDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MBDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?
